title: How Many Calories Are in a Bottle of Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a bottle of wine, including a standard 750 ml serving with full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and variations for red, white, or sweet types.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Bottle of Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry table wine (red or white), 12% ABV, average values; calories primarily from alcohol and residual sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, brand, ABV, sweetness level, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine provides about 638 kcal, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 600-650 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine bottle.

faqs.q: What about calories in white wine per bottle?
faqs.a: Similar to red; around 600-700 kcal for 750 ml dry white wine.

faqs.q: Do all wines have the same calories?
faqs.a: No—sweeter wines or higher ABV add more calories; dry wines are lower.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a bottle of wine?
faqs.a: Typically 5-10 g total carbs for dry wine, higher (20+ g) for sweet varieties.

faqs.q: Is wine calorie-dense compared to beer?
faqs.a: Yes—a 750 ml wine bottle has more calories than a 6-pack of standard beer.
